intro: Dendromyza, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds, which aids in seed dispersal. Dendromyza is typically found in temperate regions and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its unique relationship with host trees makes it an important component of forest ecosystems.
